Education.degree: Bachelor of Technology, Electrical and Electronics Engineering

Experience.description: Worked as Graduate Research Assistant at Application Development Network (ADN), DoIT, supporting University of Missouri System faculty and students. Involved in designing, planning, developing, and implementing Microsoft .Net based solutions. Developed web applications using C#, ASP.Net, JavaScript, jQuery, CSS, HTML, XML, and AJAX. Gained strong experience in data retrieval and manipulation using ADO.Net and Entity Framework. Worked extensively with .Net Server Controls, Web User Controls, and custom controls. Created and modified table definitions, stored procedures in SQL Database. Developed and modified web services using C#. Utilized Red Gate SQL Compare for database deployment. Implemented .NET security features like Form-Based Authentication and Role-Based Authorization. Involved in bug fixes and production support, working closely with Scrum Master and participating in daily scrums and weekly meetings. Key projects included: Atlas (tutoring session scheduling with availability grids, automated emails, and role-based authorization), AppInventory (application tracking system using Entity Framework, LINQ, and CSV data import), GoAdmin (mobile application master table editing with AJAX controls, n-Tier Architecture, and dynamic queries), Mizzou Checkout (web application for checkout process with SMTP server integration), and Personalized Email for Outlook (customizing outlook email).
